title: Practice-Oriented Mathematics Education Course Utilizing Digital Storytelling-Based Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary Mathematical Concepts and Basic Smartphone Usage Skills
context.additional_context: Course for in-service practitioners to enhance mathematical problem-solving skills. Provides experiential learning based on real-life scenarios through digital storytelling, overcoming technological constraints via a smartphone-centric approach.

learning_goals: Learners can explain mathematical concepts with over 80% accuracy using digital storytelling materials provided in a flipped learning environment.
Learners can reconstruct and solve real-world mathematical problems encountered in professional contexts through digital storytelling by collaborating with peers.
By the end of the course, learners can produce storytelling presentation materials applying mathematical concepts and incorporate feedback from peer evaluations at least three times.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
